text: The students at Washington sell cupcakes to raise money. Since the school colors are green and white, the cupcakes are green or white. They sell them in two different-size boxes. Maria suggests using rtio statements to advertise the cupcakes.

Student answers may vary. Examples:

  • Large box
    • The ratio of green cupcakes to white cupcakes is 8 to 10.
    • For every 4 green cupcakes, there are 5 white cupcakes.
    • There are 8 green cupcakes for every 18 cupcakes.
  • Small box
    • The ratio of green cupcakes to white cupcakes is 4 to 8.
    • For every green cupcake, there are 2 white cupcakes.
    • There are 4 green cupcakes for every 12 cupcakes.
  • From the large to the small box
    • the large box has 2 green cupcakes for every 1 green cupcake in the small box.
    • The ratio of green cupcakes in the large to the small box is 8 to 4.
    • There are 10 white cupcakes in the large box compares to 8 in the small box.
    • 5 to 4 is the ratio of white cupcakes in the large to small box.
    • The large box has 18 cupcakes compared to 12 in the small box.
• Compare your statements with those of your classmates. Are any of the ratio statements equivalent? Explain why.

Student responses will vary. Students may find

  • ratios that are the same;
  • some that are equivalent;
  • some that are in a different order; or
  • some that they disagree with.
